examples.sentence: Master particles first - They're the foundation of Japanese sentences
Practice verb conjugations daily - ます-form is essential
Learn adjective conjugation patterns - Both い and な-adjectives
Use grammar in context - Make your own sentences
Review consistently - These basics appear in all higher levels

sections.heading: JLPT N5 Grammar Overview
sections.content: JLPT N5 is the most basic level of the Japanese Language Proficiency Test. It covers fundamental grammar patterns essential for basic communication. This list includes approximately 80 core grammar points you need to master for N5.

children.heading: は (wa) - Topic Marker
children.content: 私は学生です。 Watashi wa gakusei desu. "I am a student."

children.heading: が (ga) - Subject Marker
children.content: 猫がいます。 Neko ga imasu. "There is a cat."

children.heading: を (wo) - Object Marker
children.content: りんごを食べます。 Ringo wo tabemasu. "I eat an apple."

children.heading: に (ni) - Location/Time/Direction
children.content: 学校に行きます。 Gakkou ni ikimasu. "I go to school."

children.heading: で (de) - Location of Action/Means
children.content: 図書館で勉強します。 Toshokan de benkyou shimasu. "I study at the library."

children.heading: へ (e) - Direction
children.content: 日本へ行きます。 Nihon e ikimasu. "I go to Japan."

children.heading: の (no) - Possessive/Modification
children.content: 私の本。 Watashi no hon. "My book."

children.heading: と (to) - And/With
children.content: 友達と映画を見ます。 Tomodachi to eiga wo mimasu. "I watch a movie with a friend."

children.heading: か (ka) - Question Marker
children.content: 学生ですか。 Gakusei desu ka. "Are you a student?"

children.heading: も (mo) - Also/Too
children.content: 私も学生です。 Watashi mo gakusei desu. "I am also a student."

children.heading: です/だ - To Be (Copula)
children.content: これは本です。 Kore wa hon desu. "This is a book."

children.heading: じゃない/ではない - Not (Negative)
children.content: 学生じゃないです。 Gakusei ja nai desu. "I'm not a student."

children.heading: でした - Was (Past)
children.content: 昨日は雨でした。 Kinou wa ame deshita. "It was rain yesterday."

children.heading: じゃなかった - Wasn't (Past Negative)
children.content: 学生じゃなかったです。 Gakusei ja nakatta desu. "I wasn't a student."

children.heading: ます-form (Polite Present/Future)
children.content: 食べます。 Tabemasu. "I eat/will eat."

children.heading: ません - Negative
children.content: 食べません。 Tabemasen. "I don't eat."

children.heading: ました - Past
children.content: 食べました。 Tabemashita. "I ate."

children.heading: ませんでした - Past Negative
children.content: 食べませんでした。 Tabemasen deshita. "I didn't eat."

children.heading: ましょう - Let's
children.content: 食べましょう。 Tabemashou. "Let's eat."

children.heading: ましょうか - Shall we?
children.content: 食べましょうか。 Tabemashou ka. "Shall we eat?"

children.heading: ませんか - Won't you?
children.content: 食べませんか。 Tabemasen ka. "Won't you eat?"

children.heading: 〜てください - Please do
children.content: 見てください。 Mite kudasai. "Please look."

children.heading: 〜ている - Progressive/State
children.content: 食べています。 Tabete imasu. "I'm eating."

children.heading: 〜てから - After doing
children.content: 食べてから行きます。 Tabete kara ikimasu. "I'll go after eating."

children.heading: 〜ても/でも - Even if
children.content: 雨でも行きます。 Ame demo ikimasu. "I'll go even if it rains."

children.heading: い-adjectives Present
children.content: 大きいです。 Ookii desu. "It's big."

children.heading: い-adjectives Negative
children.content: 大きくないです。 Ookiku nai desu. "It's not big."

children.heading: い-adjectives Past
children.content: 大きかったです。 Ookikatta desu. "It was big."

children.heading: い-adjectives Past Negative
children.content: 大きくなかったです。 Ookiku nakatta desu. "It wasn't big."

children.heading: な-adjectives Present
children.content: 静かです。 Shizuka desu. "It's quiet."

children.heading: な-adjectives Negative
children.content: 静かじゃないです。 Shizuka ja nai desu. "It's not quiet."

children.heading: います - Exist (Animate)
children.content: 犬がいます。 Inu ga imasu. "There is a dog."

children.heading: あります - Exist (Inanimate)
children.content: 本があります。 Hon ga arimasu. "There is a book."

children.heading: 〜たい - Want to
children.content: 食べたいです。 Tabetai desu. "I want to eat."

children.heading: 〜たくない - Don't want to
children.content: 食べたくないです。 Tabetaku nai desu. "I don't want to eat."

children.heading: 〜が欲しい - Want (object)
children.content: 車が欲しいです。 Kuruma ga hoshii desu. "I want a car."

children.heading: できる - Can do
children.content: 日本語ができます。 Nihongo ga dekimasu. "I can speak Japanese."

children.heading: 〜が好き - Like
children.content: 寿司が好きです。 Sushi ga suki desu. "I like sushi."

children.heading: 〜が嫌い - Dislike
children.content: 野菜が嫌いです。 Yasai ga kirai desu. "I dislike vegetables."

children.heading: 〜が上手 - Good at
children.content: 料理が上手です。 Ryouri ga jouzu desu. "I'm good at cooking."

children.heading: 〜が下手 - Bad at
children.content: 歌が下手です。 Uta ga heta desu. "I'm bad at singing."

children.heading: 〜が分かる - Understand
children.content: 日本語が分かります。 Nihongo ga wakarimasu. "I understand Japanese."

children.heading: 〜が要る - Need
children.content: お金が要ります。 Okane ga irimasu. "I need money."

children.heading: 〜くらい/ぐらい - About/Approximately
children.content: 三時間ぐらい。 San jikan gurai. "About 3 hours."

children.heading: 〜ごろ - Around (time)
children.content: 三時ごろ。 Sanji goro. "Around 3 o'clock."

children.heading: 〜しか〜ない - Only (with negative)
children.content: 一つしかない。 Hitotsu shika nai. "There's only one."

children.heading: そして - And then
children.content: 勉強します。そして、寝ます。 Benkyou shimasu. Soshite, nemasu. "I study. And then, I sleep."

children.heading: それから - And then/After that
children.content: 食べます。それから、行きます。 Tabemasu. Sorekara, ikimasu. "I eat. After that, I go."

children.heading: でも - But/However
children.content: 高いです。でも、買います。 Takai desu. Demo, kaimasu. "It's expensive. But I'll buy it."

children.heading: だから - So/Therefore
children.content: 暑いです。だから、窓を開けます。 Atsui desu. Dakara, mado wo akemasu. "It's hot. So I'll open the window."

children.heading: 何 (なに/なん) - What
children.content: これは何ですか。 Kore wa nan desu ka. "What is this?"

children.heading: 誰 (だれ) - Who
children.content: あれは誰ですか。 Are wa dare desu ka. "Who is that?"

children.heading: どこ - Where
children.content: どこに行きますか。 Doko ni ikimasu ka. "Where are you going?"

children.heading: いつ - When
children.content: いつ来ますか。 Itsu kimasu ka. "When will you come?"

children.heading: どう - How
children.content: どうですか。 Dou desu ka. "How is it?"

children.heading: どうして/なぜ - Why
children.content: どうして行きますか。 Doushite ikimasu ka. "Why are you going?"

children.heading: いくら - How much
children.content: いくらですか。 Ikura desu ka. "How much is it?"

children.heading: どれ - Which one
children.content: どれが好きですか。 Dore ga suki desu ka. "Which one do you like?"

children.heading: どの - Which (modifier)
children.content: どの本ですか。 Dono hon desu ka. "Which book is it?"

children.heading: 〜より - Than/More than
children.content: これはあれより大きい。 Kore wa are yori ookii. "This is bigger than that."

children.heading: 〜の方が - More (in comparison)
children.content: こちらの方が好きです。 Kochira no hou ga suki desu. "I like this one better."

children.heading: 一番 - Most/Best
children.content: これが一番好きです。 Kore ga ichiban suki desu. "I like this the most."

children.heading: 〜前に - Before
children.content: 寝る前に歯を磨きます。 Neru mae ni ha wo migakimasu. "I brush my teeth before sleeping."

children.heading: 〜後で - After
children.content: 食べた後で休みます。 Tabeta ato de yasumimasu. "I rest after eating."

children.heading: 〜から - From/Since
children.content: 9時から働きます。 Kuji kara hatarakimasu. "I work from 9 o'clock."

children.heading: 〜まで - Until
children.content: 5時まで働きます。 Goji made hatarakimasu. "I work until 5 o'clock."

children.heading: 〜間 - During/While
children.content: 休みの間旅行します。 Yasumi no aida ryokou shimasu. "I travel during the break."

children.heading: いつも - Always
children.content: いつも勉強します。 Itsumo benkyou shimasu. "I always study."

children.heading: よく - Often
children.content: よく映画を見ます。 Yoku eiga wo mimasu. "I often watch movies."

children.heading: 時々 - Sometimes
children.content: 時々料理します。 Tokidoki ryouri shimasu. "I sometimes cook."

children.heading: あまり〜ない - Not very/Not much
children.content: あまり食べません。 Amari tabemasen. "I don't eat much."

children.heading: 全然〜ない - Not at all
children.content: 全然分かりません。 Zenzen wakarimasen. "I don't understand at all."

sections.heading: Study Tips for N5 Grammar
sections.content: Master particles first - They're the foundation of Japanese sentences Practice verb conjugations daily - ます-form is essential Learn adjective conjugation patterns - Both い and な-adjectives Use grammar in context - Make your own sentences Review consistently - These basics appear in all higher levels

sections.heading: Next Steps
sections.content:
After mastering N5 grammar, progress to:

JLPT N4 Grammar - Intermediate basics Practice with real conversations Build vocabulary alongside grammar

Note: This list covers the core N5 grammar points. Some points may appear in different JLPT prep materials with slight variations.
